pullRequest.body:
(This PR continues #11472)
Prove the following basic facts about the weak topology in a topological vector space (or AddCommMonoid) `E`.
- any set that is open in the weak topology is open in the original topology.
- any function in `E` that converges to a point in the original topology (with respect to some filter) converges also in the weak topology.
- if a function in `E` converges to a point in the original topology, then its composition with a continuous linear functional converges.
- any function from `E` that is continuous in the weak topology is also continuous in the original topology.

Motivation: WeakSpace has some basic properties, analogue of which are proved for WeakDual.

I have some doubts:
- in order to avoid typeclass instance problem, I had to add a type ascription `continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] WeakSpace ùïú E` when needed. Is this fine or is there a canonical way to avoid it? (I tried to add `variable (ùïú E) in` before def/thm but it gave type mismatch in many places)
- I made two theorems about IsOpen, but not sure about the naming convention.


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
You get the type-mismatch because you have to now write `continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace k E`.
The general rule is that if you want reviews you should make sure that CI passes (you get a green checkmark after the commit and the `awaiting-CI` label will disappear), see https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html#lifecycle-of-a-pr

thanks for your comments, I wrote `ùïú E` where necessary.

In order to avoid lint errors, I deleted `toWeakSpace_eq_iff` which could be proved by one `simp only [@EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq]`.

I would like to have a comment on the naming convention of `isOpen_of_isOpen_WeakSpace`, `isOpen_of_isOpen_WeakSpace'`

Thanks for your review!
As `isOpen_of_isOpen` depends on the definitions and `isOpenMap_toWeakSpace_symm` as well, I moved everything out of namespace. I hope this is fine.
OK, I committed all your suggestions.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8593480665/job/23545039467)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8593480665/job/23545039370)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8593480665/job/23545039273)
These should be the last ones.

Sorry, a lot of these just aren't necessary because they are just chaining together very generic lemmas. I know it's hard to tell as a new contributor which things are lemmas we need versus which ones are simply missing.

Aside from `isOpen_of_isOpen`, I don't think any of the declarations you added should be in the `WeakSpace` namespace. I suggest moving them all to the end, right after the `end WeakSpace`.

Sorry for the delay in review. This should be the last set of changes.
These should be the last ones.
I don't think we want to have this lemma as it is basically the definition of continuity
I am not sure what to do with this comment, as you are using this lemma in your suggested code below.
You can just use `(continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E).cont.isOpen_preimage` instead
ok, I removed this

```suggestion
/-- The canonical map `E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] WeakSpace ùïú E` is open. -/
theorem isOpenMap (continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E) := by
  intro V hV
```

Do you mean something like
`theorem isOpenMap_continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace : IsOpenMap (continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E)`? But this is not true...

Or do you mean
`theorem isOpenMap_inv_toWeakSpace : IsOpenMap (ToWeakSpace ùïú E).symm`? I included this.

```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê Equiv.image_preimage (toWeakSpace ùïú E).toEquiv V]
  exact isOpen_of_isOpen_WeakSpace ((toWeakSpace ùïú E) '' V) hV
```
This code gives an error. Indeed, it seems to try to prove that `(continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E)` is an open map, which is not. See above.
As you didn't tell me to remove this, I assume that this is needed.
I don't see why we want to have these lemmas, they don't contain anything special about `WeakSpace`, but are simply statements about continuity and convergence.

It is true that it contains nothing special about `WeakSpace`, but as a mathematician I often say "a sequence is convergent in norm so it is convergent in the weak topology", or "a function is continuous from the weak topology, so it is continuous from the norm topology". Isn't it convenient to have such lemmas?

Not really, the first one can be written as `(y.continuous.tendsto p).comp hf`, that is almost as short as `WeakSpace.eval_tendsto_of_tendsto  hf y`. The second one is `hf.comp (continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace k E).continuous`.
ok, I removed them
You can write this as `(y.continuous p).tendsto.comp hf`
I guess you mean `((y.continuous).tendsto p).comp hf`, thank you, I used it.

As a general rule: if you want to write something which has a `rfl`-proof you can also use `change` (it is discouraged for changing something like `y : E` to `y : WeakSpace k E` because that has mathematical content, but changing `f (g x)` to `(f ‚àò g) x` is totally fine)

Moritz, I only half agree with this. While it's true that it's *acceptable*, I would say it's still discouraged, because it generally means that didn't find the right lemma, or the right lemma doesn't exist and it should be written. In this case, the right lemma is `Function.comp_apply`.
this is no longer needed as it was a part of a theorem now removed

```suggestion
theorem continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace_bijective :
    Function.Bijective (continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E) :=
  (toWeakSpace ùïú E).bijective
```

```suggestion
theorem isOpenMap_inv_toWeakSpace : IsOpenMap (toWeakSpace ùïú E).symm :=
  IsOpenMap.of_inverse (continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E).cont
    (toWeakSpace ùïú E).left_inv (toWeakSpace ùïú E).right_inv
```

Just like the preimage version that follows from continuity, I'm not sure we need this as it's just the `simp` of the application of the `IsOpenMap` result. That is, the following proves this result:
```
theorem isOpen_of_isOpen_WeakSpace' (V : Set E)
    (hV : IsOpen ((continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E) '' V : Set (WeakSpace ùïú E))) : IsOpen V := by
  simpa [Set.image_image] using isOpenMap_inv_toWeakSpace _ hV
```
However, we can keep it (without the `'` in the name) if you prefer.
Note also, you don't need to keep specifying `IsOpen[topologicalSpace-instance]`, you can just use `IsOpen`. That's one of the reasons we have a type synonym.
thanks, I used the code you suggested.

This is also not necessary, as it's just chaining of existing lemmas:
```
  (continuousLinearMapToWeakSpace ùïú E).cont.tendsto p |>.comp hf
```
ok, I removed this
This is not necessary either, and note that it's just a generalization of the previous lemma.
I removed this, see above

```suggestion
theorem isOpenMap_toWeakSpace_symm : IsOpenMap (toWeakSpace ùïú E).symm :=
```

This is already in the `WeakSpace` namespace, so no need to duplicate the name.
```suggestion
theorem isOpen_of_isOpen (V : Set E)
```

```suggestion
theorem WeakSpace.isOpen_of_isOpen (V : Set E)
```

Let's keep the diff clean
```suggestion
```

Same here
```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Algebra/Module/WeakDual): prove basic relations between the weak topology and the original topology
